title: Tax Manager
text:
Job Ref: NH-TM-05.09.15 
This West End law firm wishes to recruit a new Tax Manager into their finance team. This is an opportunity to report directly into Senior Tax Head and take on the responsibility for a broad range of annual accounts and tax returns for a portfolio of clients ranging from trusts, probates, charities and individuals. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES Manage all client work allocated by Partners and in accordance with detailed procedures and quality standards. Ensure all client work is progressed expeditiously and that the client is kept regularly informed on progress and fees and disbursements. Exercise high standards of client care in a professional and pleasant manner. Apply confidentiality and security of all the firm’s and client documentation and information. Work towards agreed levels of billing and time-recording. Ensure compliance towards Solicitors Accounts Rules and the Rules on the Professional Conduct of Solicitors. Maintain good working relationships with external institutions and organisations. Supervise, support and develop immediate support staff. In conjunction with the firm, to comply with the firm’s relevant training requirements and to contribute to the departmental seminars as may be required. Actively promote the services of the firm and its image and ethos with Partners and clients. Provide training for other members of the department in aspects of trust administration, where required. Complete and agree personal and trust tax returns using ‘MYOB’ and tax liabilities on behalf of clients and payment of tax liabilities before the due date. Prepare statements of income from trusts and estates Produce ad-hoc CGT reports, dividend reports and trust statistics for trustee meetings and fee earners. Liaise with clients, trustees, executors, investment brokers, bankers and HMRC and be first point of contact. Be able to identify tax planning opportunities for clients as and when available. 
REQUIREMENTS Good experience of UK and EU VAT Experience of working within a small team A working knowledge of Private Client Tax Issues, including IHT and trusts. Understanding of UK legal system tax and HMRC procedures. Advanced Excel High Degree of computer literacy including the use of Excel and MOYB. 
To apply contact Neil Hagan quoting ref. NH-TM-05.09.15
